overview:
Carlos Souza is the founder and CEO of Veduca, a company with the purpose of democratize top-quality education in Brazil via video-lectures from world-class universities.

Carlos is responsible for setting the overall direction and strategy for Veduca. He leads the design of Veduca’s service and development of its core technology.

Carlos has an Engineer degree from Technological Institute of Aeronautics (ITA, 2002 - rated as one of the top and most prestigious engineering schools in Brazil). After brief period in Investment Banking (Credit Suisse), he worked for 8 years in Marketing at Procter & Gamble, where he managed several brands (Pampers, Ace/Ariel, Gillette) in Brazil, Argentina and Chile.

In September 2011, Carlos left P&G to start Veduca with Andre Tachian, Eduardo Zancul and Marcelo Mejlachowicz. Veduca is on-air since March 2012 and has already 5,000 video-classes from 13 universities. Website achieved more than half a million visits with zero investment in advertising, being profiled by the main media vehicles in Brazil.
